item.title: Go as a River
item.description: Notes four corners monument ‚ÄùMan flooded the town of Iola; now nature is bringing back its ghost‚Äù by The Los Angeles Times racism & bigotry women‚Äôs suffering against bigotry, sacrifices and grief Quotes pg 7: I knew the town of Iola when it woke each morning to fragrant breakfasts and bustling farms and ranches, how the sunrise illuminated the east side of Main then inched uptown, across the train tracks and schoolyard, to ignite the tiny church's one round red and blue stained glass window.

item.title: The Tales of Genji
item.description: date: 13-09-2023, nlb seminar by professor deborah shamoon. social context tales of genji - Murasaki (purple) üíú shikibu (not real name) written in late 9th to early 10th century not a religious text unlike literature of it‚Äôs time period, it was written for entertainment because compared to most of the classics, tales of genji had less warfare, more romance.

item.title: Example
item.description: Runes are fungible tokens issued directly on Bitcoin using the Runes protocol. Proposed by Casey Rodarmor (creator of Ordinals) Doesn‚Äôt require off-chain data or a native token to operate Bitcoin Runes‚Äô onchain data storage is in the OP_RETURN part of a transaction.

item.title: Example
item.description: Use of smart contracts to Bitcoin in order to unlock Bitcoin DeFi. However, bitcoin faces the blockchain trilemma challenges. Bitcoin‚Äôs issue = composability and it‚Äôs limited scripting language L1 like Stacks is unleashing Bitcoin through Clarity (a new programming language for Bitcoin) Bitcoin‚Äôs security is high but it comes at the cost of programmability Bitcoin ordinals seen as a first breakthrough for Bitcoin application tier and could help move narrative from a pure ‚Äústore of value‚Äù to something more utilitarian.

item.title: lombok, indonesia
item.description: lombok strait: south of lombok, near kuta places to go/went **& experienced mana yoga, ashtanga yoga sore full moon soundbath yoga bat cave, mawan beach mt rinjani trekking lanne beach / pantai selong belanak for beginner surfing secret gilis tour - gilli naggu, gilii kedis and gili sudak at south-west lombok (!!! very beautiful beaches and cerulean blue waters) loose observations tourism as main income.

item.title: hiroshima museum of art observations
item.description: 3rd august 2023 nihon ga Êó•Êú¨Áîª - genre by a traditional technique from the start of the Meiji era (India ink and colours over paper and silk) v.s. to yo-ga (japanese western style) (oil paintings over canvas) some interesting pieces: Yasuda yukihiko (1884-1978) ‰∏ÄËå∂ seiichi horiuchi - children book illustrations.

item.title: Rokuon-ji Temple, Kyoto
item.description: renamed rokuon-ji but eventually became known as kinkaku-ji 1894: temple was opened to public to help it financially in 1894 in 1950, temple was burnt down by a young monk, hayashi yoken.

item.title: fukuoka art museum
item.description: 8 august 2023 Louis Joseph collin at the seaside 1892 mentor of kuroda seiki and okada saburosuke who laid foundation of japanese modern art jean michael basquiat 1984 untitled snapshot of new York city where basquat grew up azechi umetaro interest in animals, plants and people‚Äôs lives in the mountains, rather than the harshness of nature shimokawa tochiro 1958 farm village depict harsh realities of farm life zao wou ki still two of us 1974 oil on canvas studied in Paris, zao created abstract paintings on theme of nature and landscapes which are described as fusion of western and eastern aesthetics mark rothko untitled 1961 plunge daily life into the sublime of his artwork uses violet and brown and cream egami keita psychedelic batoquism no 7 combined origami paper to combine in bright colours and geometric shapes.

item.title: women writers
item.description: Sophia Tolstaya Murusaki Shikibu (wrote The Tales of Genji) .

item.title: alfred russell wallace
item.description: Alfred Russell Wallace was born in 1823, Wales, and died at the age of 90 in 1913. known as for his studies in natural history (naturalist), geographer & socialist.
